capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-documented fact. He was indeed the Potions master during my time there, and his... let's say, "unique" teaching style can be quite intimidating at first. I remember feeling a bit uneasy around him, but he did have a certain respect for those who earned it.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was a double agent working for the Order of the Phoenix while pretending to be a loyal Death Eater. It's hard to say whether his true loyalties were with the Dark Lord or with the greater good.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria mentioned that snape is affiliated with hogwarts.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit of a complicated topic, to be honest. I mean, on the surface, he was the Potions master and seemed like a pretty standard member of the faculty. But as you get to know him better, it becomes clear that there's more to him than meets the eye. He's got this... intensity, this passion for his work that borders on obsession. And let's be real, his treatment of students can be downright brutal at times. So while he was technically affiliated with Hogwarts, I wouldn't say he exactly fit in with the rest of the staff.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and seemed to have a certain... respect for the school, but at the same time, his behavior towards students, especially Harry Potter, was often quite harsh and intimidating. I think it's safe to say that Snape's loyalty was ultimately to Hogwarts itself, rather than any particular individual or group within the school.
